com.google.inject.tools.suite
Interface ProgressHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BlockingProgressHandler
public interface ProgressHandler

The ProgressHandler is responsible for displaying a progress bar or other indicator to the user during long operations. It should allow the user to cancel the operation.

Author:
Darren Creutz (dcreutz@gmail.com)

Nested Class Summary
static interface ProgressHandler.ProgressStep
          Represents a single step in a task managed by a progress bar.
 
Method Summary
 void go(java.lang.String label, boolean backgroundAutomatically)
          Actually execute the steps.
 boolean isCancelled()
          Return true if the user cancelled the operation.
 void step(ProgressHandler.ProgressStep step)
          Add a step to the progress.
 void waitFor()
          Tell the calling thread to wait until the progress handler tasks complete.
 

Method Detail

Actually execute the steps.

             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
